org.jconfigurations.converters

Class BaseCollectionConfigurationConverter<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jconfigurations.converters.BaseCollectionConfigurationConverter<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    CollectionConfigurationConverter<T>, ConfigurationConverter<Collection<T>>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ListConfigurationConverter, SetConfigurationConverter

    public abstract class BaseCollectionConfigurationConverter<T>
extends Object
implements CollectionConfigurationConverter<T>
    Handy abstract class that implementations of CollectionConfigurationConverter can extend. The BaseCollectionConfigurationConverter will initialize an instance of the Collection's implementation class supplied by subclasses by calling its no-arg constructor.
    Author:
    George Aristy
    See Also:
    BaseCollectionConfigurationConverter(org.jconfigurations.converters.ConfigurationConverter, java.lang.String, java.lang.Class)

    • Field Detail

      • elementConverter

        protected final ConfigurationConverter<T> elementConverter

    • Constructor Detail

      • BaseCollectionConfigurationConverter

        protected BaseCollectionConfigurationConverter(ConfigurationConverter<T> elementConverter,
                                               String delimiter,
                                               Class<? extends Collection> collectionType)
        Parameters:
        elementConverter - the converter to use to convert each substring to the appropriate type.
        delimiter - the delimiter to use to tokenize the configuration's value. The configuration string will be tokenized using the standard String.split(java.lang.String) method.
        collectionType - the implementation class - must have an accessible no-arg constructor.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null.

    • Method Detail

      • convert

        public Collection<T> convert(String value)
                      throws ConfigurationException
        Description copied from interface: ConfigurationConverter
        Converts value into an instance of type T.
        Specified by:
        convert in interface ConfigurationConverter<Collection<T>>
        Returns:
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - if value cannot be converted to an instance of type T.
